name: Infaunal abundances from mud samples taken from the Outer Ards penninsula (Northern Ireland) in 2014 and 2016 as part of an assessment of the Modiolus modiolus reefs
description: This dataset contains information on infaunal abundance and biomass from sedimentgrabs taken off the coast of the Ards Penninsula, Northern Ireland in 2014 & 2016.This survey was carried out to contribute to a larger projectto assess the status and extent of Modiolus modiolus biogenic reefs in this area. Thebiogenic reefs were in an unfavourable condition even though this Annex 1 habitat was the reason for the designation of the Strangford Lough SpecialArea of Conservation (SAC). This survey was carried out on boardthe RV Corystes using a 0.1m2 day grab. The infaunalcommunities were identified and weighed, particle size analysis and carbon &nitrogen analysis were carried out onthe samples. In total there were 36 samples taken (only 30 could be analysed forinfauna). The most abundant speciesrecorded was the tunicate Dendrodoa grossularia and the most frequentlyrecorded species was the molluscLeptochitonasellus.
